div.ab:
بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
من موسى بن كــعب إلى صاحب مقرّة ونوبة سلم على
أوليا اللّه وأهل طاعته وأحمد إليهم اللّه ا
لدى لإ إلّه الا
أمّا بعد قد عرفت الّذي صولحتم عليه والّذي جعلتم على
أنفسكم من الوفا به فأحرزتم بذلك دماكم وأموالكم إن
أنتم وفيتم واللّه تبارك وتعالى يقول في كتابه أوفوا
بعهد اللّه إذا عهدتم ولا تنقضوا الإيمان بعد
توكيدها وقد جعلتم اللّه عليكم كفيلا إن اللّه
يعلم ما تفعلون وقال أوفوا بعهدي أوف بعهدكم
وإيّاي فارهبون وقد وفينا لكم بالّذي جعلنا لكم علينا من ا
لكف عن دماكم واموالكم وعرڤپ امپكم ڤى
وسكونكم حيث أحببتم منها واختلاف تجّاركم إلينا لا يصل
إليهم منّا ظلم ولا غشم ولا يعتدى على أحد ممّن قبلنا منكم
ولا يمنع من حقّه ولا يحال بين تجّاركم وبين ما أرادوا آمنين
مطمأنّين حيث سلكوا من بلادنا وفا بعهدنا وصدقا لقولنا
وإيمانا بربّنا وتصديقا لنبيّنا
وأنتم فيما بيننا وبينكم على غير ذلك لا تودون إلينا
ما عليكم من البقط الّذي صولحتم عليه ولا تردّون من أبق
إليكم من أرقّائنا ولا يأمن فيكم تجّارنا ولا تعجّلون تسريح
رسلنا إلينا وأنت تعرف أن أهل الأديان كلّها
والملل الّذين لا يعرفون ربّا ولا يومپون ببعث ولا يرجون ثوابا
ولا يخافون عقابا لا يهجمون تاجرا ولا يحبسون رسولا
وأنت تظهر لأهل ملّتك الإيمان بالّذي خلق
السّموت والأرض وما بينهما وتومن بعيسى بن مريم وبكتابه
وتظهر العدل لهم والعمل بالحق وعملكم فيما بيننا
وبينكم مخالف لما تظهر فقد أتاكم تاجر من تجّار أهل
بلدنا يقال له سعد قد ذهب بأموال كثيرة زائغا
بها من أهلها فحبستموه قبلكم وحلتم بينه وبين من يطلبه بحق
ومنعتموه منه وبعث إليكم رجل من أهل أسوان يقال له
محمّد بن زيد تاجرا له في تجارته وطلب حقوق له فا
حپپسپموه وما كان معه من المال ڤكپپ إلى الى
على أسوان يذكر أنّه كتب إلى خليفتك
فيه فكتب إليه خليفتك يسله أن يبعث إليه محمّد
بن زيد صاحب ذلك التّاجر ليستخلفه على ما كان معه من
المال فبعثه إليه في رهط من المسلمين فضربه ضربا
سيّئا وكسر يده وحبسه ثلث ليال عنده حتّى ظن أنّه قاتله
ثم خلّى سبيله فدعاه سلم بن سليمن عاملي على أسوان بالبيّنة
على وصول تاجره إليكم وعلى ما صنع به خليفتك
فأتاه برهط من المسلمين عدول من سكّان أسوان فشهدوا
له بما ذكر من أمره وأمر تاجره وكتب إلي بذلك كلّه
وبعث إلي محمّد بن زيد صاحب ذلك التّاجر فوافى
قدوم بطرة رسولك إلينا فجمعت بينهما ومع بطرة
رهط من أهل ملّتك فذكروا أنّهم
ظنّوا حين أخذوه أنّه ممّن كان يغير عليهم من البجة
فأمرت غوث عون بن سليمن قاضي أهل مصر أن ينظر في أمرهم
ثم تحمّلتم على مثل ما تحمّل عليه النّاس من الحق والعدل
فقضى على بطرة أن يرد ذلك التّاجر وما كان معه من
المال إن كان حيّا وإن كان قد قتل فعليكم ديته
ألف دينر
وبعث إليكم سلم رسولا له منذ تسعة أشهر ورسولا منذ أربعة
أشهر فحبستموهم معما عندكم من أرقّا أهل الإسلم
وأهل ذمّتنا وما عليكم من البقط فإنّه قد ذكر
لي أن عليكم بقط سنين لم تودوه وما بعثتم به من البقط
بعثتم بما لا خير فيه بين أعور أو أعرج أو كبير ضعيف
أو صبي صغير
فانظر فيما كتبت إليك به وعجّل
البعثة إلينا بما بقي عليكم من البقط للسّنين الّتي
قبلكم ولا تبعث بما لا خير فيه فلا نقبله وابعث
إلينا بتاجر محمّد بن زيد وبما كان معه من المال إلّا إن
يكون قد قتل فتبعث بألف دينر ديته وبما كان معه
من مال وابعث إلينا سعد التّاجر الّذي قبلكم ولا توحر
من ذلك شيئا إن كنتم تحبّون أن نفي لكم بعهدنا
ونكون على ما كنّا عليه من الاستقامة لكم وعجّل
ذلك ولا توحره وإن أنت لم تمتثل رأيت فيما
بيني وبينكم رأي إن شا اللّه فإنّي قد أحببت أن أعذر
إليكم وأتّخذ الحجّة عليكم والسّلم على أوليا
اللّه وأهل طاعته وكتب ميمون يوم الأحد
لاثنتي عشرة ليلة بقيت من رجب سنة إحدى وأربعين ومائة

In the name of God the Compassionate, the Merciful
From Mūsa b. K[aʿb to] ... ... master (ṣāḥib) of Muqurr[a] and Nubia. Peace be upon From Mūsā b. K[aʿb to] ... ... master of Muqurr<a> and Nubia. Peace be upon
the friends (awliyāʾ) of God and those who obey him... To them do I praise God, the friends of God and those who obey Him.... To them do I praise God,
other than whom there is no God.
To continue. You (sing.) know about which an agreement was made with you and the fulfilment of it To continue. You (sing.) know that on the basis of which a peace agreement was made with you and that which you took
upon yourselves to fulfil, so preserving your blood and property if which you took upon yourselves, so preserving your blood and property if
you fulfil [it]. God, blessed and exalted is He, says in His book "Fulfil
the compact of God when you make a compact, and do not break the oath after
it has been affirmed and you have made God your guarantor; verily God
knows what you do." And He said "Fulfil my compact and I shall fulfil your compact; knows what you do." And He said "Fulfil my compact and I shall fulfil your compact and mine;
so fear me." We have fulfilled for you that which we took upon ourselves for you in
desisting from your blood and your property and you (sing.) know your security in our land turning away from your blood and your property and you (sing.) know your security in our land
and your dwelling wherever you wish in it and the repairing of your merchants to us, no oppression
or harm comes to them from us; no one of you who is among us is attacked by us or wrong comes to them from us; no one of you who is among us is attacked by us
nor is he denied his right; no obstacle is placed between your merchants and what they want - [they are] safe
and at ease wherever they go in our land, [this being] in fulfillment of our compact, in truth to our word and contented wherever they go in our land, [this being] in fulfillment of our compact, in truth to our word
in belief in our Lord and in trust in our Prophet. in belief in our Lord and in verification of our Prophet.
You however, in that which lies between us, behave otherwise. You do not bring to us You however, in that which lies between us, behave otherwise. You do not hand over to us
that to which you are liable according to the baqṭ on the basis of which / about which agreement was made with you; nor do you return those of our what you owe of the baqṭ about which a peace agreement was made with you; nor do you return those of our
slaves who run away to you; nor are our merchants safe among you; nor do you hasten to permit slaves who run away to you; nor are our merchants safe among you; nor do you hasten to send
our emissaries [back] to us. You know that the people of all religions our messengers [to return] to us. You know that the people of all religions
and the confessions which neither know a lord, nor believe in a resurrection, nor hope for recompense, and the persuasions (milal) which neither know a lord, nor believe in a resurrection, nor hope for recompense,
nor fear punishment, [even these] do not attack a merchant or detain a messenger. nor fear punishment, [even these] do not attack a merchant or detain an emissary.
You (sing.) make manifest to the people of your confession belief in Him who created You (sing.) make manifest to the people of your persuasion belief in Him who created
the heavens and the earth and what is between them, you (sing.) believe in Jesus the son of Mary and his book,
and you (sing.) make manifest to them justice and the doing of what is right, while what you do in that which is between you and you (sing.) make manifest to them justice and the doing of what is right, while what you do in that which lies between you
and us is contrary to that which you make manifest. One of the merchants of the people
of our country, Saʿd by name, came to you with much wealth, having made off
with it from its owners, and you detained him among you, stood between him and the one who rightly pursued him
and protected him from him. [Secondly] a man of the people of Aswān, named
Muḥammad b. Zayd, sent to you a merchant of his, on his business and seeking rights for him.
You detained him and the wealth that he had with him, and my governor over Aswān
wrote to me, mentioning that he had written to your deputy
concerning him and that your deputy had written to him, asking him to send to him Muḥammad
b. Zayd, the master of that merchant, so that he might make over to him with the wealth which he (the merchant) had
with him. So he (the governor) sent him (Muḥammad) to him (the deputy) with a group of Muslims, and he (the deputy) gave him (Muḥammad) a bad
beating and broke his hand and detained him for three nights until he (Muḥammad) thought that he would kill him.
Then he (the deputy) let him go, and my governor over Aswān, Salm b. Sulaymān, asked him (Muḥammad) for evidence
of the arrival of his merchant to you and of that which your deputy had done to him.
He (Muḥammad) then brought to him a group of Muslims, persons of good morals from the inhabitants of Aswān, and they bore witness He (Muḥammad) then brought to him a group of Muslims, witnesses of probity (ʿudūl), from the inhabitants of Aswān, and they bore witness
for him of what he had mentioned in the matter of himself and the matter of his merchant. He (Salm) then wrote to me about all of this to him (Salm) of what he (Muḥammad) had mentioned in the matter of himself and the matter of his merchant. He (Salm) then wrote to me about all of this
and sent to me Muḥammad b. Zayd, the master of that merchant. He came at the time of the
arrival of BṬRH (Peter), your emissary to me, so I brought them together. With Peter arrival of BṬRH (Peter), your messenger to me, so I brought them together. With Peter
[was] a group of your confession and they mentioned [was] a group of your persuasion, and they mentioned
that they thought, when they took him (the merchant), that he was one of the Beǧa who make attacks on them. that they thought, when they took him (the merchant), that he was one of the Beja who make attacks on them.
I then instructed ʿAwn b. Sulaymān, qāḍī of the people of Miṣr, to look into their affair; I then instructed Ğawṯ b. Sulaymān, qāḍī of the people of Miṣr, to look into their affair;
then were you made to bear the like of the right and justice which the people (al-nās, i.e. Muslims?) are made to bear, then were you made to bear the like of the right and justice which the people (scil. of Egypt) are made to bear.
for he judged that Peter should return that merchant, together with the wealth that is He judged that Peter should return that merchant, together with the wealth that is
with him, if he is alive, and if he has been killed you are liable to blood money of with him, if he is alive, and if is dead, you are liable to blood money of
one thousand dinars.
Salm sent to you a messenger of his nine months ago, and a messenger four months Salm sent to you an emissary of his nine months ago, and an emissary four months
ago, and you detained them, together with those slaves of the people of Islam and of the people
protected by us who are with you, and that of the baqṭ to which you are liable. For he (Salm) mentioned to me protected by us who are with you, as well [being liable to] that to which you are liable in the baqṭ. It has been mentioned to me / He (Salm) mentioned to me
that you are liable to the baqṭ of [outstanding] years, which you have not made over ; [that, in respect of] such of the baqṭ as you have sent, that you are liable to the baqṭ of [several] years, which you have not fulfilled; as for that which you have sent in accordance with the baqṭ,
you have sent that in which there is no good - the one-eyed, or the lame, or the weak old man,

So look (sing.) into that about which I have written to you (sing.) and hasten (sing.)
the dispatching to us of that of the baqṭ for which you are still liable for the [outstanding] years, which is the dispatching to us of your remaining liability according to the baqṭ for the years for which
with you, and to not send (sing.) that in which there is no good, for we do not accept it; and send (sing.) you owe and to not send (sing.) that in which there is no good, for we do not accept it; and send (sing.)
to us the merchant of Muḥammad b. Zayd and the wealth which was with him, unless
he has been killed, in which case send (sing.) the thousand dinars, his blood money, together with
the wealth which was with him; and send (sing.) to us Saʿd the merchant who is among you and be not tardy (sing.)
in that in any respect if you wish us to fulfil for you our compact
and to continue as we did in dealing correctly with you. Hasten (sing.)
that and to not delay (sing.) it. If you (sing.) do not obey, I shall have
my view concerning what is between you and me, God willing. I have wanted to eceed the usual bounds in exhorting you
and to take proof against you. Peace be upon the friends of
God and those who obey him. Written by Maymūn on Sunday,
the twelfth night remaining in Rajab in the year 141. twelve nights remaining of Raǧab in the year 141.
